definitions: characterized by the presence of fog obscuring visibility
lacking clarity or precision in thought or understanding
examples: The foggy morning made driving conditions dangerous
We couldn't see the bridge in the foggy weather
His foggy memory couldn't recall the exact details
The instructions were foggy and hard to follow

definitions: having one's plans or attempts prevented or defeated by opposition
covered or wrapped with thin metal sheeting for protection or decoration
examples: The thieves were foiled by the new security system
Her escape attempt was foiled at the last moment
The foiled chocolate remained fresh for weeks
The foiled windows reflected the harsh sunlight

definitions: able to be bent or doubled over on itself for storage or transport
examples: The foldable chair fits easily in the car trunk
They bought a foldable table for their small apartment

definitions: made to bend or collapse for convenient storage or carrying
currently bending over or doubling on itself in layers
examples: The folding screen divided the room into two spaces
She carried a folding umbrella in her purse
The folding paper created intricate origami patterns
Watch the folding motion of the bird's wings

definitions: having a simple, friendly manner typical of ordinary people in casual settings
examples: The politician's folksy charm appealed to rural voters
The restaurant had a folksy atmosphere with checkered tablecloths

definitions: feeling warmth, affection, or liking for someone or something
naively hopeful or optimistic about unlikely outcomes
examples: She was fond of her grandmother's old recipes
The teacher grew fond of her challenging students
His fond hopes of winning the lottery never materialized
It was a fond dream that peace would come soon

definitions: behaving in a playful, joking manner not meant to be taken seriously
examples: Stop fooling around and finish your homework
He was just fooling when he said he'd quit

definitions: showing poor judgment or lack of wisdom in actions or decisions
examples: It was foolish to drive in such terrible weather
She made a foolish mistake trusting that stranger

definitions: having feet of a particular type, number, or condition as specified
examples: The sure-footed mountain goat climbed the steep cliff
The four-footed animal left tracks in the mud

definitions: able to go wherever one wishes without responsibilities or commitments holding one back
examples: After retirement, they were footloose and ready to explore
The footloose bachelor traveled to a new country every month

definitions: prohibited by rules, laws, or authority from being done or used
considered taboo or too dangerous to approach or discuss openly
examples: Smoking is forbidden inside the hospital building
The forbidden fruit always seems most tempting
They explored the forbidden areas of the abandoned factory
In their culture, such topics were forbidden to discuss

definitions: having an appearance or manner that seems hostile, unfriendly, or dangerous
examples: The castle had a dark, forbidding appearance
His forbidding expression discouraged anyone from approaching

definitions: lacking naturalness or spontaneity, appearing strained or artificial
done involuntarily under pressure or compulsion rather than by choice
examples: Her forced smile didn't hide her disappointment
The conversation felt forced and uncomfortable
The prisoners were subjected to forced labor
It was a forced marriage arranged by families

definitions: expressing opinions or making statements in a strong, confident, and effective way
examples: She made a forceful argument for policy change
His forceful personality dominated every meeting

definitions: done using physical force or violence rather than by choice or consent
examples: The police made a forcible entry into the building
The forcible removal of protesters sparked controversy

definitions: situated at or toward the front part of something
examples: The fore section of the ship took the most damage
The horse's fore legs were stronger than the hind ones

definitions: giving a strong feeling that something bad or unpleasant is going to happen
examples: The dark clouds created a foreboding atmosphere
She had a foreboding sense that the mission would fail

definitions: mentioned or written before in the preceding part of a text or discussion
examples: The foregoing analysis shows clear market trends
Based on the foregoing evidence, we reached our conclusion

definitions: already decided or certain to happen before proper consideration or completion
examples: The election result seemed like a foregone conclusion
It was a foregone certainty that prices would rise

definitions: executed with the palm of the hand facing the direction of movement in sports
examples: Her powerful forehand shot won the tennis match
He practiced his forehand drive for hours

definitions: ranking first in importance, excellence, or achievement in a field
positioned at the very front or leading edge of something
examples: She was the foremost expert on climate change
Safety is our foremost concern in this project
The foremost riders in the race broke away early
The general stood at the foremost position

definitions: relating to courts of law or legal proceedings and evidence
applying scientific methods to investigate crimes and analyze evidence
examples: The forensic evidence proved his innocence
She works as a forensic accountant investigating fraud
The forensic team examined the crime scene carefully
Forensic analysis revealed the document was forged

definitions: able to be predicted or anticipated based on current knowledge or trends
examples: There are no problems in the foreseeable future
The accident was a foreseeable consequence of negligence

definitions: giving advance indication or warning of something that will happen later
examples: The dark opening scene was foreshadowing the tragic ending
His early symptoms were foreshadowing serious illness

definitions: covered with trees and undergrowth forming a forest ecosystem
examples: The forested mountains provided habitat for wildlife
Once forested land was cleared for agriculture

definitions: lost or given up as a penalty for wrongdoing or failure
examples: The forfeit goods were sold at public auction
His forfeit rights could not be restored

definitions: given up or taken away as punishment for breaking rules or laws
examples: The team forfeited the game for using ineligible players
His forfeited property was seized by the government

definitions: shaped or formed by heating and hammering metal into shape
created falsely to deceive by imitating something genuine
examples: The blacksmith displayed beautifully forged iron gates
The forged steel blade was incredibly strong
The forged signature fooled several bank officials
Police discovered forged passports in his possession

definitions: apt to forget things easily or failing to remember information regularly
examples: Grandmother became more forgetful as she aged
The forgetful student constantly misplaced his homework

definitions: not memorable or impressive enough to be worth remembering
examples: The movie was pleasant but ultimately forgettable
It was a forgettable meal at an average restaurant

definitions: ready and willing to forgive others for their faults or wrongdoings
allowing for errors or imperfections without serious consequences
examples: She had a forgiving nature despite being hurt
His forgiving attitude helped heal family relationships
This recipe is forgiving if you make small errors
The forgiving fabric hides minor stains well

definitions: failed to be remembered or left behind in one's memory or awareness
examples: The forgotten civilizations left mysterious ruins behind
She felt like a forgotten friend from the past

definitions: split or divided into two or more branches or separate parts
examples: The forked road required choosing between two paths
Lightning created forked patterns across the night sky

definitions: pitifully sad and lonely, appearing abandoned or without hope
examples: The forlorn puppy waited by the empty house
She looked forlorn sitting alone at the party

definitions: given official status or form through established procedures and documentation
examples: The formalised agreement was signed by both parties
Their formalised procedures ensured consistent quality

definitions: given official status or form through established procedures and documentation
examples: The formalized contract outlined all terms clearly
They formalized their partnership with legal documents

definitions: having an important and lasting influence on the development of something
examples: His formative years were spent in rural Kentucky
Reading was a formative experience in her childhood

definitions: brought into existence or shaped into a particular configuration or structure
examples: The newly formed committee met for discussions
Clouds formed rapidly as the storm approached

definitions: relating to or derived from ants or the acid they produce
examples: Formic acid gives ant bites their characteristic sting
The formic smell indicated an ant colony nearby

definitions: inspiring fear or respect through being impressively powerful, capable, or intense
examples: She faced formidable opposition in the election
The mountain presented a formidable challenge to climbers

definitions: lacking a clear or definite shape, structure, or character
examples: The formless mass of clay awaited the sculptor
His ideas remained formless and needed organization

definitions: produced according to a mechanical or set pattern lacking originality
examples: The movie followed a formulaic plot audiences expected
Her formulaic approach to teaching bored the students

definitions: created or prepared methodically according to a plan or formula
examples: The scientist formulated a new theory about gravity
Their carefully formulated strategy proved successful

definitions: played loudly with strong volume in musical performance
examples: The forte passage required powerful playing from orchestra
She sang the forte sections with impressive volume

definitions: about to happen or appear in the near future
willing to divulge information or offer help when needed
examples: Details about the forthcoming election were announced
Her forthcoming book explores climate change solutions
He wasn't very forthcoming about his past experiences
The witness was forthcoming with crucial information

definitions: direct and outspoken in manner, saying exactly what one thinks
examples: I appreciate your forthright assessment of the situation
Her forthright manner sometimes offended sensitive people

definitions: constituting number forty in a sequence or being one of forty equal parts
examples: They celebrated their fortieth wedding anniversary together
This is the fortieth edition of the encyclopedia

definitions: strengthened with defensive works to protect against attack
enhanced by adding vitamins, minerals, or other nutrients
examples: The fortified castle withstood numerous sieges
Troops defended the fortified positions successfully
Fortified cereal provides essential vitamins for children
The fortified milk contained added vitamin D

definitions: happening or produced once every two weeks or fourteen days
examples: The magazine has fortnightly publication schedule
They meet fortnightly to discuss project progress

definitions: happening by accident or chance rather than by design, often with favorable results
examples: Their fortuitous meeting led to a business partnership
It was fortuitous that she found shelter before the storm
